inputPortDescriptors.description: Directory holding the input 'reference' raster. This is the raster that is treated as having greater horizontal accuracy.
inputPortDescriptors.name: reference

inputPortDescriptors.description: Directory holding the input 'source' raster. This is the raster that is treated as having worst horizontal accuracy.
inputPortDescriptors.name: source

inputPortDescriptors.description: Grid spacing to use in tie point search (specified in pixels). This value must be an integer, and ideally will be an odd value. Default: 501.
inputPortDescriptors.name: grid_spacing_px

inputPortDescriptors.description: Window size to search around each grid point (specified in pixels). This value must be an integer, and ideally will be an odd value. Default: 501.
inputPortDescriptors.name: window_size_px

inputPortDescriptors.description: Number of max iterations to use in searching for tiepoints. Larger values may result in better tiepoints, but will always result in slower task run times. Default: 1000.
inputPortDescriptors.name: n_iter

inputPortDescriptors.description: The threshold used for determining convergence in solution of tiepoint calculation. Smaller decimal values may result in better tiepoints, but will always result in slower task run times. Default: 1e-4.
inputPortDescriptors.name: term_eps

inputPortDescriptors.description: No data value in the source raster. Default: 0.
inputPortDescriptors.name: src_nodata

inputPortDescriptors.description: No data value in the reference raster. Default: 0.
inputPortDescriptors.name: ref_nodata

outputPortDescriptors.description: Directory holding output tiepoint GeoJSON and GCP text file.
outputPortDescriptors.name: data

name: calculate_tiepoints
description: WARNING: THIS TASK IS EXPERIMENTAL AND HAS NOT BEEN ROBUSTLY TESTED. Given a 'source' raster and a 'reference' raster (in the same coordinate system), this task calculates tie points between the two images, in the form of a Polyline GeoJSON file. The tiepoints are calculate based on the shift required to adjust the source reference to align with the reference raster. Tiepoints are calculated using a regular grid within the source raster, using the input specified grid spacing in pixels (grid_spacing_px). At each point, a window of size of the input specified size (window_size_px) is inspected in the source and reference rasters, and a calculation is run to determine the best X,Y translation that would align the windows between the two images. Where no solution is found, a tiepoint will not be created. Where a solution is found, the tie point is calculated according to the output X,Y translation parameters. In addition to the tiepoint geometries, the task also outputs a ground control point (GCP) text file, suitable for use in gdal_translate. This can be used to apply the tiepoints as GCPs within the source raster, and by piping the result to gdal_warp, can produce a new, shifted source raster that is more closely aligned to the reference raster. For more information about this task, please contact Mike Gleason (michael.gleason@digitalglobe.com).
